TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9180=Studio experience in areas not normally offered, with the focus to be determine d by the art faculty. May be repeated fo r credit. Lecture/Studio: Hours vary. 1 Unit, 25594=Advanced level work for students who have completed the two printmaking classes Art-241 and Art-341 and either Art-111 or Art-151. It is expected that a student will incorporate the issues introduced in the previous courses. Focus will be on the creation of a self-directed body of work, visual research, advanced development of concepts using disciplinary media and techniques, and will result in a public display or presentation of work. May be repeated for credit. 1/2 Unit, 26880=Advanced level work for students who have completed the ceramics sequence through the 300 level. It is expected that a student will incorporate the issues introduced in the previous courses. Focus will be on the creation of a self-directed body of work, visual research, advanced development of concepts using disciplinary media and techniques and will result in a public display or presentation of work. May be repeated for credit. 1/2 Unit, 28234=Advanced level work for students who have completed the sculpture sequence through the 300 level. It is expected that a student will incorporate the issues introduced in the previous courses. Focus will be on the creation of a self-directed body of work, visual research, advanced development of concepts using disciplinary media and techniques, and will result in a public display or presentation of work. May be repeated for credit. 1/2 Unit}
textBeforeTable: Offerings Lecture and group discussion on arts and crafts as a form of communication. Emphasis on teaching arts and crafts in schools. Includes work in fibers, clay, paper, and other areas. (Does not apply to major or minor programs in art.)
